attributes.action: Counsellors on wards where 16 to 25-year-olds are receiving cancer treatment
attributes.background: Counsellors should be available for young people receiving cancer treatment. When I was diagnosed with cancer, it was a complete shock for me and my family. I found it harder to deal with mentally than the actual treatment itself.
attributes.additional_details: Despite being treated on a specialist adolescent unit for 16 to 25-year-olds, no counsellor is available for people in this age group. I and others would benefit from a counsellor being on wards and instantly available. The counsellor could then deal with any worries as they arise, and people would not need to wait for appointments in the community.

attributes.action: Recognise parental  alienation and make it a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Parental Alienation
This can occur when a child is caught in between their parents divorce or separation, the offending parent deliberately turns their child against their ex so that they eventually cut off all contact. This can be described as one parent ‘trying to turn their child into a soldier.
attributes.additional_details: Anthony Douglas, the chief executive of Cafcass, vividly described it as one parent ‘trying to turn their child into a child soldier in a battle’. Previously parental alienation has been dismissed as a common product of bitterness about a failed relationship, but it is separate from these normal feelings of hurt. Parental alienation is in fact an internationally recognised form of parental psychological abuse and undermines the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the UN Convention on the rights of the child. In Mexico and Brazil, it is even classed as a criminal offence.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence in the UK not to report discovering a death
attributes.background: Recently my brother passed away and the person who was staying with him never rang for help just left him on his own. I want to make this a criminal offence in the UK as it’s against the law in other countries. I need to get as many signatures as I can so no other family has to go through this.

attributes.action: Don't charge food businesses 20% VAT on turnover
attributes.background: I want the government to stop charging food businesses 20% VAT. The reason for this is because our industry has barely any VAT to claim back and yet we get charged that 20% on our turnover which is unfair compared to other industries. This ruins cash flow and causes business owners financial issues.

attributes.action: Same sex unmarried/civil partnered parents to be on Childs birth certificate
attributes.background: In the UK same sex parents of donor children are unable to both go on their childs birth certificate - unless they are married/ civil partnered preconception or the child was conceived through the help of a registered fertility clinic. My son has only me on his birth certificate and it's wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
Why is it ok for heterosexual couples to both be registered on birth certificate, some of these Fathers registered are not even the biological Fathers and no questions asked.

If anything were to happen to me my son would be an orphan due to no other parent having rights over him.

As a nation we have come so far with equality and rights, however the legislation and laws need to be updated to reflect this.

attributes.action: Only allow uni students to vote in their home town, not where they are studying.
attributes.background: Currently, university students can either vote in their uni town or home town and many choose the former. The huge density of students in certain areas now mean that students control the vote and their issues can dominate the political agenda and effectively disenfranchise the local community.
attributes.additional_details: This is not driven by anti-student sentiment but more through a sense of democracy. For example, if there was a General Election in their first week at uni, the student could vote in the uni town without any knowledge of local issues or the local MP. They will probably spend 27 months over 3 years at uni and yet a parliamentary term is 60 months, so their vote affects the area long after they've left! They can also vote in local elections, on local issues from Day 1.

attributes.action: Award a separate medal to recognise the Bomb Disposal Service in WWII
attributes.background: A watercolour began my journey of discovery leading to the heroic acts by the artist Capt. John Hannaford & his colleagues. 350 men were killed defusing, clearing bombs, UXBs, over 50,000 across the UK. Many were killed clearing mines from our beaches. They deserve official recognition.
attributes.additional_details: Capt. Hannaford’s notes, photographs, his in-depth interview at 95 for the IWM with a Channel 4 documentary highlight his belief that the bomb disposal service men and women were forgotten. Footage included other WWII bomb disposal officers telling their heroic story and acts of courage of all their servicemen. Whilst researching I discovered the most powerful evidence was a quote from our great statesman Winston Churchill who said, "Bomb Disposal should be recognised for their dangerous work!"

attributes.action: Grant student mothers the same protections as working mothers
attributes.background: Flexible working, maternity leave and nursing facilities are examples of protected provisions available to workers. Student mothers are just as vulnerable to maternity discrimination, yet these protections are seldom extended to them.This blind-spot has led to avoidable adversity and exclusion.
attributes.additional_details:
Education institutions are required under employment law to make maternity provisions for working mothers, yet there is no legal requirement ensuring that the same rights are extended to students who are mothers.

In spite of the Equality Act 2010, the rights of student mothers are primarily determined at their institution's discretion. Student mothers are easily marginalised and often squeezed out of the education system as a result. This must change.

attributes.action: Scrap the sugar tax.
attributes.background: This year the Government brought in a sugar tax, which is a tax on any drink with above a certain level of sugar content. The problem is that companies are now replacing sugar with artificial sweeteners and these are argued to be more harmful than sugar. Scrap the tax for choice and for our health.
attributes.additional_details: Drinks with more than 8g per 100ml face a tax rate equivalent to 24p per litre. Those containing 5-8g of sugar per 100ml face 18p per litre. While this may appear as if you just pay more for the product, instead it is becoming very difficult to get a product without artificial additives. With many pubs, bars no longer serving sugar drinks. Aspartame is one of the most popular sweeteners and some studies indicate it could be carcinogenic. We deserve real choice.

attributes.action: Ban 'anti-homeless' benches in the UK
attributes.background: Just under a quarter of a million people are estimated to be sleeping rough in Britain, 2018. 'Anti-homeless' benches force the homeless to sleep on the cold floor this winter. Divided benches are an example of how the housing problem has not been tackled, with efforts to only blanket the truth.
attributes.additional_details: More than one in three people sleeping rough have been deliberately hit or kicked or experienced some other form of violence whilst homeless. If these individuals could spend the night on a bench, they could be away from the floor, nightclub doors or store entrances, in safer areas. The homeless are entitled to the same as any person, and these benches must be banned.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for MPs & immediate family to own shares in weapon manufacturers
attributes.background: If an MP has a personal interest in share prices increasing for weapon manufacture companies, they cannot be considered to be truly impartial when creating policy surrounding weapon sales to countries with poor human rights records.

attributes.action: Stop the tax payer funding Royal weddings.
attributes.background: Stop the tax payer funding royal weddings including the upcoming wedding. The Government needs to advise the Queen of the public outrage at this disgraceful waste of public money. The Royal Family have more than enough tax payer money to fund this flamboyant wedding themselves.
attributes.additional_details: At a time of public funding cuts to libraries, roads maintenance, police service and other publicly funding bodies it is a disgrace that the Government is even considering funding this wedding.

attributes.action: To create awareness amongst children/teenagers about Autism/Aspergers in schools
attributes.background: I would like the government make this a small part of personal studies in schools to give children/teenagers an understanding about children living with Autism/Aspergers in social situations. It will help them to be able to recognize behavior traits and actions in order to understand.
attributes.additional_details:
A small part of the curriculum would help so many children with Autism/Aspergers be able to feel comfortable in social situations such as playing, school and parties without being judged, bullied or name called. 
Being able to integrate into social situations is key but not easy for children living with these conditions. 
Ways of communicating and showing emotion are very different from child to child but can be seen as behavior problems if not understood. 
All children deserve to happy & secure

attributes.action: Promote plant-based lifestyles
attributes.background: We now know we are 12 years away from climate catastrophe. And that the single biggest thing we can do to reduce our impact on the Earth is to eliminate animal products from our diet. Yet any talk of the government encouraging us to adopt a vegan diet is swept aside as ‘nanny-stateism.’
attributes.additional_details:
Animal products are everywhere and not just in our food. If the public have any hope of achieving a plant-based lifestyle they need state help. The government needs to:
 
• Make menus in public institutions entirely vegan 
• Tax any product that contains animal products 
• Stop giving incentives to people who farm animals 
• Incentivise those who grow or produce vegan foods 
• Educate the public about plant-based living
 
For the future of our planet this subject urgently needs debate in parliament.

attributes.action: Life sentence for causing death by dangerous driving, including first offences
attributes.background: July 1st 2017 was the day my 17 year old brother, Stephen, was killed due to dangerous driving. The driver was on multiple drugs as well as being fuelled with alcohol. The car they had was not theirs, they had no insurance, no tax and no licence! They also seriously injured a young girl.
attributes.additional_details: The offender was not sentenced until 9 months after Stephen’s death. During this time we didn’t see the offender show any remorse. They appeared to be out partying, drinking and taking drugs. The offender was sentenced to just 8 years in prison and because they pleaded guilty, they got a third knocked off this sentence and because it was a first offence the sentence will be reduced by further third.

attributes.action: Allow victims of Child Sexual Abuse the location of their Offenders release
attributes.background: The man who abused me has been released from prison. I am still not allowed to know where he is located. A high-profile sex offender who destroyed my life. I should have the right to know where he is to minimise the risk to myself and my family.
attributes.additional_details:
Clare’s Law: The Domestic Violence Scheme, that offers members of the public the right to ask the police if their partner may pose a risk to them. 
Sarah’s Law: The Sex Offender Disclosure Scheme, that allows anyone to formally ask the police if someone with access to a child has a record for child sexual offences. 

He is on licence conditions to not come near my home, so he was released information of my vicinity. Victims should be allowed this information about their offender, especially when the offender is allowed to know where their victim lives.

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of Afghans
attributes.background:
Many Afghans deported risk either being killed or never being able to start a life again. Some have been killed. A country at war for the last 40 years cannot promise anything, let alone the beginning of a new life.
Please help us get 100,000 signatures and stop the deportations.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/zainadin-fazlie-deport-home-office-taliban-afghanistan-shot-dead-refugee-a8536736.html

attributes.action: Make all trespassing a criminal offence
attributes.background: There has been an uplift of illegal encampments in UK. Recently my council has had to pay out more than one hundred thousand pounds in clean up fees. Trespassers do not respond to civil rulings. To give the police more powers, I propose that all trespassing be made a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details:
People cannot dictate where they can live by simply by squatting on land they do not own. Police need powers so owners can be protected.

-100K of clean-up from Milton Keynes Council 
-Reported attacks to Police 
-Closing of School sports days https://www.miltonkeynes.co.uk/news/milton-keynes-primary-school-forced-to-cancel-sports-day-after-illegal-travellers-camp-on-field-1-8540123 
https://www.miltonkeynes.co.uk/news/illegal-travellers-camps-causing-problems-in-milton-keynes-1-8524022

attributes.action: Stop unregulated animal “rescues” bringing animals into the UK
attributes.background: Many “rescues” bringing dogs into the UK are un-regulated businesses disguised as “rescues”. Only registered animal charities should be allowed to bring dogs into the UK. It should be an offence for unregistered “rescues” to bring dogs into the UK for sale or adoption.
attributes.additional_details: They can cause dire cruelty to dogs. No regulation means cash in hand. No help is given when dogs are homed. Dogs are un-assessed, homes are un-checked & NO rescue back up is given to help. These people are just dog SELLERS. ‘Donations’ & ‘adoption fees’ for dogs go straight into their pockets. The fundraising is also a scam!

attributes.action: Make it illegal to leave dogs outside in winter without access to heated shelter
attributes.background: Frequently when the community contact the RSPCA with concerns about a dog being left outside in the cold for prolonged periods of time, they are told that nothing can be done if the dog has access to shelter. Often this consists of a wooden kennel which provides no protection from the cold.
attributes.additional_details:
Section 4 of the Animal Welfare Act 2006 already legislates against unnecessary suffering.  This Act should be amended to ensure any dog left outside for long periods of time during the winter months also has access to a heated shelter.  

If the owner fails to comply, then steps should be taken to prosecute the owner and the dog seized.

attributes.action: Respond with urgency to the IPCC report to limit global warming
attributes.background: We have been warned, we must act now.  Parliament must act to change electricity production to renewable sources within 10 years.  Bring forward measures to decarbonise car transport within 10 years. Insulate every property within 10 years. And take every other reasonable measure to cut carbon.

attributes.action: Ban all gambling advertising on TV
attributes.background: Problem gambling cost this country up to 1.2 billion pounds per year according to official figures. It is also linked to mental health and homelessness. Along with smoking gambling adverts do not belong on the television. Many gambling adverts promote it as glamorous - this is highly irresponsible.

attributes.action: Urge Iceland to stop killing endangered whales
attributes.background: They have killed endangered Fin and Blue whales. They must stop.

attributes.action: Create a national campaign to raise awareness of the symptoms of Type 1 diabetes
attributes.background:
Type 1 diabetes is an autoimmune condition which can not be prevented and currently can not be cured. It is an unrelenting condition that affects every aspect of life both physically & mentally.
Awareness of the symptoms is low and children are dying due to late / missed diagnosis.
attributes.additional_details:
In the uk there are approximately 400,000 people living with type 1 diabetes with 29,000 of them being children. This number is increasing by 4% each year. Over the last 20 years there has been a 5% increase each year in the under 5s age group!! (stats from JDRF website)
I have four children, two of which have Type 1 diabetes. We were lucky we knew the signs, others are not so lucky.
We have had a national awareness campaign for meningitis & sepsis, we need one for Type 1 diabetes.

attributes.action: Give people accused of sexual offences anonymity until charge.
attributes.background: No one suggests names should never be released. What I believe is that there is a correct time to release names and that is not before a person is charged with an offence.

attributes.action: Require large employers to publish their parental leave and pay policies
attributes.background: There is already a requirement that companies have such policies (which may match the statutory minimum). However, this information is not generally publicly available and often is not shared with potential employees. Sadly, individuals risk discrimination if they ask for it.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014 Glassdoor found that 78% of women would not ask about maternity policies at interview, and only 1/3 of them received this information in induction packs. Yet salary, holiday, pension entitlements and health insurance are all routinely discussed at the point of hiring.

These policies could be included with gender pay gap reporting for large companies. This would be logistically easy for companies to do. We call upon the government to adopt this position.

attributes.action:
Replace petition.parliament.uk with a site that collects votes for and 
against
attributes.background: Frequently, petitions and similar are reported as having collected so many thousand votes. This only represents one side: without knowing how strong the opposing feeling is, the true public opinion can be misreported - and, decision-makers can be pushed into actions the majority don't actually want.
attributes.additional_details: A petition is arguably the modern version of the pitchfork-wielding mob; it's very easy for individuals or groups to whip up strong feelings. Those opposing the motion feel disenfranchised - there is no *simple* and *immediate* way to register their opposition; they can only set up a counter-petition, which is liable to be rejected, or at least involves a delay, thus giving unfair advantage to the first petition.

attributes.action: Extra teaching staff in Primary Schools to support children with Dyslexia.
attributes.background: My 8yrs old son has been screened at his school for Dyslexia&he is classed as severe. The school support my son as much as they can but any specific teaching support for the condition will start when he attends secondary school. This is wrong primary level is when help/support will make a difference

attributes.action: NHS Allocation of Funds for PFO Closure in Selected Ischaemic Stroke Patients
attributes.background: Young and unsuspecting people suffer from stroke due to a hole in their heart called a PFO. There is a straight forward procedure scientifically proven to be statistically significant in reducing secondary stroke in these patients. The NHS does not currently allocate funding for this procedure.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some links to relevant research: 

http://www.onlinejacc.org/content/69/11_Supplement/1260

http://www.onlinejacc.org/content/56/13_Supplement/B108.3

Professional boxer Dan Sarkozi is an example of an unsuspecting victim of cryptogenic stroke. Dan suffered a cryptogenic stroke due to a hole in his heart which was originally believed to be a PFO. He faced the proposition of losing his career and spending his life on blood thinning medication due to lack of funding for this procedure.

attributes.action: Strip First Group and MTR of their South Western Railway Franchise.
attributes.background: Since taking over the Franchise from Stagecoach, the service that customers have had to put up with has been disgraceful. High prices, poor service, constant delays and without any punishment from the Government. Time it stops!

attributes.action: Increase firework restrictions to prevent use during daytime.
attributes.background:
Fireworks can cause distress to many domestic and wild animals, in addition to affecting those with anxiety disorders and asthma.
I propose increasing the firework time restrictions to allow their use only after dark to allow those affected by them to plan their daily activities without fear.
attributes.additional_details:
At approximately 9:20am on 05/11/2018 two fireworks were set off, causing my rescue lurcher, Harry, to panic and run away. Around one hour later he was hit by a train and killed. He was a well behaved dog who was out in daylight in a familiar area, and he would still be alive today had these fireworks not been set off.

I acknowledge that many members of the public enjoy fireworks, and believe that only allowing use at night - when visibility is better - is a reasonable compromise.

attributes.action: Official apology to the Polish nation for UK actions at the Yalta conference
attributes.background: The apology should recognise British's abandonment of the Polish nation and 200,000 troops of the Polish Armed Forces serving under the high command of the British Army during the conference in Yalta. The UK left Poland and Poles to the grip of Soviet tyranny.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom failed to meet their diplomatic, military and moral obligations with respect to the Polish nation during the prelude to and aftermath of WWII. At Yalta, Churchill agreed that Stalin should keep the Soviet gains in Poland and that tens of thousands of veteran Polish troops under British command should lose their Kresy homes to the Soviet Union. In reaction, thirty officers and men from the II Corps committed suicide. Only 25 MPs at that time voted against Churchill plan!

attributes.action: Raise the parental responsibility age to 16.
attributes.background: Joshua Connolly Teale, sadly died May 2018 due to taking 1 MDMA tablet. Joshua was on a camping trip with 3 adults who agreed to supervise him. He had a fatal reaction to the drug, which showed its effects quickly to which the adults supervising failed to provide basic medical attention.
attributes.additional_details: The adults were intoxicated, an ambulance wasn't called until the next day, no reasonable medical care was given even though he wasn't breathing and they didn't contact Joshua’s family. The case inspector said that if Joshua had been under 16, he would have arrested the adults. The law says that parental responsibility ends at 16, so justice can't be served. The coroner criticised the adults for a "gross failure to provide basic medical attention for a child whose condition clearly required it.

attributes.action: Stop arms deals with Saudi Arabia in light of Kashoggi and actions in Yemen.
attributes.background: The U.N has written a damning report of Saudi Arabia's actions in Yemen. Stating “There is little evidence of any attempt by parties to the conflict to minimize civilian casualties.” And also in light of the possible assassination of the journalist Jamal Kashoggi.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/aug/28/all-sides-in-yemen-may-be-responsible-for-war-crimes-say-un-experts

attributes.action: Be able to register at two GP surgeries for students with two residences.
attributes.background: Students who have multiple residences during the year have the problem of when needing a prescription re-registering at GP surgeries every time they go to and from uni and home.
attributes.additional_details: For example, most women use contraception. To be able to get this, you must have a check up with the GP every three-six months to get your new pack. This causes a problem if you're at home when you are registered at your university GP and need a new pack of contraception.

attributes.action: Expand driving penalties to include the charge vehicular manslaughter
attributes.background: I think that the increase in dangerous, reckless and careless driving needs to be properly addressed. In the wrong hands a car is as lethal as a loaded gun. Death should be charged as vehicular manslaughter and life changing injuries as attempted vehicular manslaughter.
attributes.additional_details: Although courts now have to power to sentence those who cause death by dangerous driving to 14 years to life, this penalty is rarely, if ever used. I feel that if the charge included the term manslaughter, not only would the perception of motorists change, but judges would be more inclined to sentence those who have caused death or life changing injuries, whilst driving at excessive speed, whilst using a mobile device, under the influence of drink/drugs to an appropriate custodial sentence.

attributes.action: Minimum of 1 England cricket Test match to be on free-to-air TV per year
attributes.background: Cricket participation levels in the United Kingdom are decreasing every year across all age groups (http://bit.ly/2MmseSJ) and this can be linked to the move in 2005 to show all England internationals exclusively on Sky Sports. It's time Test cricket was protected by Ofcom.
attributes.additional_details:
The ECB have recently dedicated to showing 2 T20 England Internationals a year from 2020 (https://ind.pn/2LUb4iV). 

However, this is not enough. It is time that some England Test matches are added to Category A of the "Ofcom Code on Sports and Other Listed and Designated Events" (https://wiki.sh/zehw) with a focus placed on Australia matches during an Ashes series.

attributes.action: New EU membership referendum asking leave or remain until 55% majority reached
attributes.background: Given there are controversies, divisions and near impasse after the narrow simple majority in 2016 EU referendum to leave, with more information available Parliament to restore pre 2016 status and legislate for new same referendum until a minimum 55% threshold is reached by either side
attributes.additional_details: The 1974 referendum to join EU had 67% majority but 2016 EU referendum to leave was decided by a narrow simple majority of 51.9% leaving bitterness and deep divisions as both sides accuse the other of misleading the public. A divided nation fears walking into an unknown future. With clearer information now on consequences of remain or leave the 2016 outcome be set aside and another referendum could unite people behind a decisive outcome until a minimum majority of 55% of those voting is reached.

attributes.action: Ban animal glue traps
attributes.background:
Glue traps are used as a method of trapping animals however this results in an agonising, slow and painful death for the creature who has sadly been caught. 
Commonly these traps are often laid down to catch vermin however many animals such as Endangered rodents, lizards and even birds are trapped.
attributes.additional_details: Many companies thought America have already banned the sale of these awful death traps.

attributes.action: Make paying rent enough proof that you are able to meet mortgage repayments!
attributes.background:
Me and my husband are hoping to buy a house! Which is going to be a difficult process! 
We have been renting for 3+ years 
Never once defaulted on our rent payments we have paid around £20000 in rent payments! Why is this not considered when apply for a mortgage!
attributes.additional_details: they still solely look at your income! When on paper you are paying a high figure for rent each month, which would indicate you are able to meet a payment for your own home!

attributes.action: Impose trade sanctions on Japan in response to decision to leave IWC agreement.
attributes.background: The Japanese have announced that they are once again going to allow commercial whaling. This plan will, beginning summer 2019 will permit the brutal harpooning of beautiful, intelligent and endangered mammals such as the Minke Whale. The dead animals will be used in sushi, candles and jewellery.
attributes.additional_details: In 1982 the IWC (International Whaling Commission) decided there should be a pause in commercial whaling of all whale species. This pause remains in place today. Japan has announced it will begin commercial whaling in June 2019 against the 1982 IWC agreement. UK Secretary for Environment, Michael Gove said Britain would "continue to fight for the welfare of these majestic mammals". To demonstrate this "fight" the UK government should, with immediate effect, impose trade sanctions on Japan.

attributes.action: The NMC's financial management and cost effectiveness should be reviewed.
attributes.background: It is unclear from NMC annual reports and PSA performance reviews whether the regulator is operating effectively and efficiently from a financial perspective. The public impact and benefits of spending, including capital expenditure and remuneration are unclear using current measures.
attributes.additional_details: During the year 2016/17 the NMC reported £86.155 million in revenue.In 2015/16 revenue totalled £80.265 million. During 2016/17 expenditure totalled £86.646 million. 2015/16 expenditure was £76.344 million. The regulator is generating more revenue and has become more expensive to run. These increases are set within a context of executive resignations, investigations by the Professional Standards Authority and failure in one of the key performance criteria set out by the PSA in 2016/17.

attributes.action: UK Government to be responsible for planning that affects historic environment
attributes.background: Local councils do not have the necessary expertise to make planning decisions when the historic environment is at stake. The UK Government should take back responsibility for these decisions from local councils, to protect the integrity of historical and cultural sites.
attributes.additional_details: The NPPF fails to protect the integrity of historical and cultural sites. Planners lack the wisdom to appreciate them. These problems are far-reaching and threaten the destruction of our historic environment as well as the squandering of tax payers’ money.

attributes.action: Grant President Donald Trump a full State Visit
attributes.background:
Following President Trump's recent successful visit to our country, the next step should be to allow him the privilege of a full State Visit.

President Trump is the democratically elected President	& as such should be treated with the respect his position holds
attributes.additional_details: We the people of the UK request that President Trump is invited to the UK, given a full state visit, he should also be given the honour of addressing Parliament and the people of the UK.

attributes.action: Revoke Northern Rail's Charter for disability access failures
attributes.background: Northern Rail fail in their commitments to the Equality Act by treating disabled customers less favourably than non-disabled customers.
attributes.additional_details:
They allow you to book scooter/ramp assistance and then deny access to the train when the customer arrives. This can be intimidating and humiliating them at times.

Northern Rail’s policy is outdated and their treatment of disabled people is unacceptable. The Equality Act 2010 was introduced to help ensure businesses treat everyone fairly. It protects anyone who is disabled, is thought to be disabled, or is with someone who is disabled. It gives these people rights to access goods or services in a way that means they are not treated less favourably than people without a disability

attributes.action: Make The Disability Symbol For Parking/Toilets Inclusive Of Hidden Disability
attributes.background:
Does the government feel that only wheelchair users are classed as disabled when 93% diagnosed with a hidden dissability are blue badge holders?
We propose a change of the current disabled symbol to the universal symbol of a blue circle as an adjustment to reduce prejudice discrimination and stigma
attributes.additional_details:
Most blue badge holders without obvious physical impairment who have parked in wheelchair symbol spaces have experienced animosity and prejudice by members of the public who judge them to be fraudulently taking up the space of 'disabled people' 
As a representative of the charity Epilepsy Sucks UK and mother of a son diagnosed with a severe form of epilepsy and autism who is a blue badge holder I have experienced this myself. 
I urge all with hidden disabilities to sign and state your diagnosis.

attributes.action: To make Party political Manifestos legally binding once elected.
attributes.background: Parties of all political persuasions have attempted to gain votes  by making headline gestures that they can save millions, they then renege on this pledge. This petition is trying to seek full transparency on manifestos and exactly how they will be implemented by financially backing their claims.
attributes.additional_details: Whether its student fees, the NHS, Police, immigration or universal credit. This debate should it happen will focus all political parties to sound out financial and political options; before making manifesto statements. This will show that the parties are 100% certain that they can implement and fully back up their claims. Additionally a penalty system would need to be proposed for those who do not carry out the manifesto pledge are duly summoned to public recourse and/or financial penalty.

attributes.action: Place ‘not all disabilities and illnesses are visible’ signs on disabled toilets
attributes.background: Those living with unseen disabilities and invisible illnesses can need; and have the right to use, disabled toilet facilities. Yet current signage is not inclusive, overlooks and marginalises those who need to use them, but have no outward or visible indicators of their needs.
attributes.additional_details: The current signage on disabled toilets does not represent our current understanding of hidden disabilities and invisible illnesses; by updating signage on all pre-existing, and all new build disabled toilets we can improve the quality of life for thousands of people around the U.K.  By adding this new signage alongside the pre-existing wheelchair emblem, we both include those living with hidden disabilities and invisible illnesses, and promote equality of toilet access across wider society.

attributes.action: Stop the use of Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources (child spies).
attributes.background: Currently Juvenile CHIS (child spies) can be used to gather information to do with offences such as gang violence, drug offences and child sexual exploitation. They can be authorised for covert activity for up to one month which the government is trying to increase to 4 months.
attributes.additional_details: The Home office has given no numbers of how many child spies are used, how the risk assessments are carried out and whether the handlers are trained to assess juvenile mental health. The capacity for children to consent to being spies is dubious given they must feel under pressure from an authority figure (the police force) and are vulnerable in a dangerous situation. Refer to 35th Report of Session 2017-2019 of the House of Lords Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee.

attributes.action: Do not raise fuel duty in the Budget
attributes.background: The Chancellor has indicated he is considering raising fuel duty in the 2018 Autumn Budget. RAC Fuel Watch data shows fuel prices are at their highest for four years with drivers paying £7 more per fill-up on average than 12 months ago and £15 more than in 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has the highest duty rate for diesel and the eighth highest for unleaded in the EU. Further increases would put UK drivers and businesses at a bigger disadvantage compared to our European counterparts. Motorists already contribute around £46bn in motoring related taxation each year and higher fuel prices mean the Treasury is already benefiting from extra VAT receipts on fuel costs. 

The Treasury’s own analysis in 2014 showed that lower fuel duty actually boosts economic growth which in turn yields higher revenues from other tax receipts over a long-term period.

We believe the Chancellor risks pushing further economic hardship on motorists for what is an essential item for over 40 million drivers and therefore we call on Philip Hammond to abandon any plans to raise fuel duty.
